author: Brian Josephs
title: USC Head Coach Steve Sarkisian Is Reportedly Taking a Leave of Absence
text:
UPDATE (8:01 p.m.): It appears that USC head coach Steve Sarkisian showed up to practice drunk this morning, a problem that has plagued him all year long.
Scott Wolf, who covers USC for the Los Angeles Daily News , is reporting that USC has dealt with multiple instances of Sarkisian's inebriation, including drinking Patron Tequila after victories in the locker room, and at one point, passing out on a team flight back from a game because he was so drunk.
BREAKING: #USC players said Sarkisian drank and passed out on flight back from Washington State game in 2014. Some reportedly took photos
— InsideUSC (@InsideUSC) October 11, 2015 Player on last year's #USC team claims Sarkisian drank bottle of Patron Tequila after Notre Dame game at Coliseum in 2014
— InsideUSC (@InsideUSC) October 11, 2015 BREAKING: #USC assistants pulled Steve Sarkisian out of player huddle on sideline during Arizona State game. Believed he was not sober
— InsideUSC (@InsideUSC) October 11, 2015 These reports come on the heels of Sarkisian appearing drunk at a USC donor event back in August.
Original story: USC still hasn't really righted the ship following the Pete Carroll era. Steve Sarkisian took over after Lane Kiffin 's failed regime. After a disappointing 3-2 start following a loss against the Huskies, Sarkisian's direction is looking shaky, too.
Trojan news didn't get better on Sunday. The school announced that Sarkisian is taking a leave of absence after missing today's practice.
Two sources at USC say Steve Sarkisian was sent home by athletic director Pat Haden earlier today.
— Bryan Fischer (@BryanDFischer) October 11, 2015 Haden didn't reveal Sarkisian's specific condition, but he told reporters that Sarkisian didn't sound right when he called inquiring why he missed practice.
"I was at a basketball event earlier today when I got a call to say Sarkisian was not at practice," he said. "I called Steve and he made it clear to me that he was not healthy, and I asked him to take an indefinite leave of absence. I think this is the right thing for our team."
Offensive coordinator Clay Helton will serve as USC's interim head coach.
[ via ESPN ]
